repo.name: dockerfiles

body: Also factored out the Qt version so it only needs to be changed in 3 places when we upgrade to the next version: `version_qt.sh`, GitHub workflows, and the windows builder image (for its `FROM` directive). - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/dockerfiles/220)

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,5 +119,33 @@ parse_arch() {
     usage
     exit 1
   fi
+
+  if [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "release" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="Release"
+  elif [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "debug" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="RelWithDebInfo"

comment_data.body: No, that's way too slow. Release with debug info is ok for dependencies.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,5 +119,33 @@ parse_arch() {
     usage
     exit 1
   fi
+
+  if [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "release" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="Release"
+  elif [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "debug" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="RelWithDebInfo"

comment_data.body: Ah, for deps. I always mod my Debug profile with -Og .
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -109,5 +119,33 @@ parse_arch() {
     usage
     exit 1
   fi
+
+  if [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "release" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="Release"
+  elif [ "$BUILD_TYPE" = "debug" ]; then
+    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE="RelWithDebInfo"

comment_data.body: It's an arg. This is the default arg. I picked 6.2.4 because that one won't change, while the 6.8.1 will move.

commit.message:
feat: Add support for asan/tsan/ubsan in macOS Qt build.

Also factored out the Qt version so it only needs to be changed in 3
places when we upgrade to the next version: `version_qt.sh`, GitHub
workflows, and the windows builder image (for its `FROM` directive).

feat: Add support for asan/tsan/ubsan in macOS Qt build.

Also factored out the Qt version so it only needs to be changed in 3
places when we upgrade to the next version: `version_qt.sh`, GitHub
workflows, and the windows builder image (for its `FROM` directive).

repo.description: Dockerfiles for (cross-)compiling TokTok projects for various platforms

title: feat: Add support for asan/tsan/ubsan in macOS Qt build.
